required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Time Restricted Feeding on Nonalcoholic Fatty Liver Disease ( TREATY-FLD )：a 12-month Follow-up Study
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Time-Restricted Feeding on Nonalcoholic Fatty Liver Disease in Obese Adults: a 12-month Randomized Clinical Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Nanfang Hospital of Southern Medical University

clinical_study.source: Nanfang Hospital of Southern Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: Time restricted feeding (TRF) is a novel type of intermittent calorie restriction diet that involves eating a daily period of 8 hours or less. This is a 6-month follow-up study of TREATY-FLD trial to evaluate the effect of time restricted feeding (TRF) on hepatic fat contents and cardiometabolic risk factors in obese adults over 6 months compared to continuous energy restriction (CER).

primary_outcome.description: Intrahepatic fat content will be assessed by MR mDixon-Quant

secondary_outcome.description: Liver fiber will be assessed by liver Fibrotouch
Visceral fat will be assessed by abdominal CT scan
Body fat will be assessed by whole-body dual x-ray system
Insulin sensitivity will be assessed by HOMA-IR

arm_group.description: Participants will receive a diet of 1500-1800kcal/d for men and 1200-1500kcal/d for women during a window of 8 h/d (8 am to 4 pm).
Participants will follow receive a diet of 1500-1800kcal/ d for men and 1200-1500kcal/d for women, without restriction on feeding time.

intervention.description: Participants will receive a diet of 1500-1800kcal/d for men and 1200-1500kcal/d for women during a window of 8 h/d (8 am to 4 pm).
Participants will follow receive a diet of 1500-1800kcal/ d for men and 1200-1500kcal/d for women, without restriction on feeding time.

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Endocrinology and Metabolism, Nanfang Hospital, Southern Medical University

facility.name: Nanfang Hospital of Southern Medical University

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Nanfang Hospital of Southern Medical University
responsible_party.investigator_title: Deputy director of Department of Endocrinology and Metabolism
